snippet: A city epidemiologist said that a failure to recognize symptoms and quarantine patients quickly enough may have led to 20 confirmed cases of the disease.
abstract: Dr Jay Varma, health department’s deputy commissioner for disease control, says rare outbreak of measles in New York City may have been spread by failure of medical workers to recognize disease quickly enough and to quarantine patients; says department is investigating whether some of the 20 confirmed cases, which are concentrated in northern Manhattan, might have resulted from exposure in medical facilities.
lead_paragraph: A city epidemiologist said that a failure to recognize symptoms and quarantine patients quickly enough may have led to 20 confirmed cases of the disease.

headline.main: Measles Outbreak May Have Spread in Medical Facilities, a New York City Official Says
headline.print_headline: Measles Outbreak May Have Spread in Medical Facilities, a City Official Says
